JPARSEC API

    Description

    JPARSEC is a Java package of astronomical resources for standard ephemerides calculations, focused on accuracy, completeness, and easy of use.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
jparsec.astronomy
Provides classes for general astronomy tasks.
jparsec.astrophysics
Classes to operate with measurements and spectra in astrophysics.
jparsec.astrophysics.gildas
Classes to manipulate Gildas files.
jparsec.astrophysics.photometry
Classes to operate with astrophysical fluxes and photometric bands of instruments.
jparsec.ephem
Provides general classes for basic ephemeris calculation.
jparsec.ephem.event
Accurate prediction of astronomical phenomena.
jparsec.ephem.moons
Implements several theories of the motion of natural satellites.
jparsec.ephem.planets
Provides additional classes for ephemerides of planets, comets, and asteroids.
jparsec.ephem.planets.imcce
Provides classes for applying the old IMCCE theories VSOP87, Series96, and ELP2000 Lunar Solution.
jparsec.ephem.probes
Ephemerides calculation for spacecrafts and artificial satellites.
jparsec.ephem.stars
Reduction from stellar catalog coordinates to apparent positions, and ephemerides for double/variable stars.
jparsec.graph
Creates charts using JFreeChart, SGT, VISAD, SurfacePlotter, and JMathPlot.
jparsec.graph.chartRendering
Provides classes for sky and planetary rendering.
jparsec.graph.chartRendering.frame
Provides support classes to render the sky and planets with easy.
jparsec.io
Provides methods for input/output, such as to read catalogs or to create reports.
jparsec.io.device
Classes that designs the driver interfaces to control astronomical hardware, and also implements them with virtual devices.
jparsec.io.device.implementation
Classes to control specific astronomical devices like telescopes and cameras.
jparsec.io.image
Provides support for fits and raw image, as well as methods to draw or deal with images.
jparsec.math
Tools to apply different common math operations in astrophysics.
jparsec.math.matrix
Tools to apply different common math operations with matrices.
jparsec.model
Basic models in astrophysics.
jparsec.observer
Provides the necessary tools for selecting and managing location data.
jparsec.test
JPARSEC tests.
jparsec.time
Provides the necessary tools for time calculations.
jparsec.time.calendar
Provides the necessary tools for calendar conversions.
jparsec.util
Provides several utilities for configuring/maintaining JPARSEC.
jparsec.vo
Classes to provide Virtual Observatory services.

    Description

    JPARSEC is a Java package of astronomical resources for standard ephemerides calculations, focused on accuracy, completeness, and easy of use. It responses to a demand in the astronomical community for a modern tool for astronomical ephemerides and also for astrophysical research (modeling). This tool is suitable for

  • Developing free software that requires maximum accuracy in ephemerides calculations, whether by using JPL DE4xx ephemeris or not.

  • Applying astrophysical models, specially in the field of star formation.

  • Developing aplications that use Virtual Observatory tools.

  • Developing astronomical almanacs and planetarium programs.

  • Astronomical teaching.

  • Planetary observations and many more.

    The main object of JPARSEC is to provide developers with an adequate library to create new astronomical applications. JPARSEC can be used in it's own (there are a large number of examples available) by developers, astronomers, and scientists.

    See http://conga.oan.es/~alonso/jparsec/jparsec.html for more details. A wiki page is also available at http://conga.oan.es/~alonso/doku.php?id=jparsec_wiki to help new users.
